00075 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00076 {
00077   //load_config_file("MODULES.txt");
00078 
00079   // Parse the command line
00080   ARGUMENTS arguments;
00081   int ret = analyze_command_line (argc, argv,arguments);
00082   if(ret!=0) return ret;
00083   std::cout << "Starting event" << std::endl;
00084   // Give the command line arguments to the navigator
00085   SetupNavigator::Instance()->SetCommandLineArgs(arguments);
00086 
00087   // Read in the configurations file
00088   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->LoadConfigFile(arguments.mod_file.c_str());
00089   if(ret!=0) {
00090      std::cout<<"Error: Problem loading MODULES file"<<std::endl;
00091      return ret;
00092   }
00093 
00094   // Open the input tree file
00095   EventNavigator& navi = EventNavigator::Instance();
00096   if ( ! navi.ConnectInput(arguments.infile.c_str()) ){
00097     std::cout << "Failed to open input file '"
00098               << arguments.infile <<"'.  Exiting." << std::endl;
00099     return 1;
00100   }
00101     
00102   // Make an initial call to singleton objects that are very likely to be called at some point.
00103   ret = PrepareSingletonObjects(arguments);
00104   if(ret!=0) {
00105      std::cout<<"Error: Problem creating a singleton object..."<<std::endl;
00106      return ret;
00107   }
00108 
00109   // Now that we've loaded the TSetupData for this run check if there are any
00110   // suggested replacements for the wiremap data
00111   //CheckSetupData(navi.GetSetupData(), arguments.correction_file);
00112 
00113   //Event Tree
00114   TTree* eventTree = navi.GetRawTree(); 
00115 
00116   // Let's open the output file for analysis data, histograms and so on.
00117   TFile *fileOut = new TFile(arguments.outfile.c_str(), "RECREATE");
00118   if(!fileOut->IsOpen()){
00119     std::cout << "Could not open ROOT output file " 
00120               << arguments.outfile << std::endl;
00121     return 1;
00122   }
00123   modules::navigator::Instance()->SetOutFile(fileOut);
00124 
00125   // Now let's setup all the analysis modules we want
00126   // NOTE: This has to be done after the output file was opened else the
00127   // modules wont have a directory to store things to.
00128   ret= modules::navigator::Instance()->MakeModules();
00129   if(ret!=0) {
00130     std::cout << "Problem creating up analysis modules." << std::endl;
00131     return ret;
00132   }
00133   
00134   // Setup the analysed pulse map to store / read in the pulses
00135   ret = PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(fileOut);
00136   if(ret!=0) {
00137     std::cout << "Problem preparing analysed pulse map." << std::endl;
00138     return ret;
00139   }
00140 
00141   // Finally let's do the main loop
00142   fileOut->cd();
00143   try {
00144     Main_event_loop(eventTree,arguments);
00145   }
00146   catch (std::exception& e){
00147     std::cout << "Terminating due to unexpected exception:\n" 
00148               << e.what() << std::endl; 
00149   }
00150   catch (...){
00151     std::cout << "Terminating due to unknown exception" << std::endl;
00152   }
00153   
00154   // and finish up
00155   fileOut->cd();
00156   gAnalysedPulseTree->Write();
00157   fileOut->Write();
00158   fileOut->Close();
00159   navi.Close();
00160   return 0;
00161 }
00162 
00163 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00164 Int_t Main_event_loop(TTree* dataTree,ARGUMENTS& arguments)
00165 {
00166   //Loop over tree entries and call histogramming modules.
00167   EventNavigator& enav = EventNavigator::Instance();
00168   Long64_t nEntries = enav.GetInputNEntries();
00169   std::cout << "Raw data tree contains " << nEntries 
00170             << " entries." << std::endl
00171             << "Processing file, which may take a while..."
00172             << std::endl;
00173 
00174   //set up the input data
00175   TGlobalData* raw_data = enav.GetRawData();
00176   if ( raw_data ){
00177     raw_data->Clear("C");
00178   }
00179   
00180   enav.MakeLoopSequence(arguments).Run();
00181   std::cout << "Finished processing data normally" << std::endl;
00182   return 0;
00183 }

00186 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 void ClearGlobalData(TGlobalData* data)
00188 {
00189   // TODO: this comment is now gibberish.
00190   // We could put this into TGlobalData::Clear(), but we need
00191   // to be sure that's okay at the alcapana level. That is, if
00192   // Clear() deletes the TPulseIsland objects, but g_event doesn't
00193   // own the pulses, they would be deleted later. A solution is to
00194   // be sure that TGlobalData isn't called in alcapana, or ensure
00195   // that g_event owns the pulse islands at that level.  
00196   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapIter;
00197   StringPulseIslandMap::iterator mapEnd = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.end();
00198   for(mapIter = data->fPulseIslandToChannelMap.begin(); mapIter != mapEnd; mapIter++) {
00199     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00200     std::vector<TPulseIsland*>& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00201     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00202       delete pulse_vector[i];
00203       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00204     }
00205     pulse_vector.clear();
00206   }
00207 
00208 
00209   for(SourceAnalPulseMap::iterator mapIter=gAnalysedPulseMap.begin();
00210      mapIter != gAnalysedPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00211 
00212     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00213     AnalysedPulseList& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00214     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00215       delete pulse_vector[i];
00216       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00217     }
00218     pulse_vector.clear();
00219   }
00220   //  gAnalysedPulseMap.clear();
00221 
00222   for(StringDetPulseMap::iterator mapIter = gDetectorPulseMap.begin(); mapIter != gDetectorPulseMap.end(); mapIter++) {
00223     // The iterator is pointing to a pair<string, vector<TPulseIsland*> >
00224     std::vector<TDetectorPulse*>& pulse_vector= mapIter->second;
00225     for(size_t i=0; i<pulse_vector.size(); i++){
00226       delete pulse_vector[i];
00227       pulse_vector[i] = NULL;
00228     }
00229     pulse_vector.clear();
00230   }
00231   gDetectorPulseMap.clear();
00232 }

00235 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00236 void PrintSetupData(TSetupData* s_data)
00237 {
00238   if(!s_data) return;
00239   // print things out
00240   std::map<std::string, std::string>::iterator it_info;
00241   std::cout << "### TSetupData ###\n"
00242             << "Bank  Detector Name  Clock Tick (ns)  Pedestal (ADC)"
00243             << "  Trigger Polarity  Time Shift (ns)  No. of Bits\n"
00244             << "----  -------------  ---------------  --------------"
00245             << "  ----------------  ---------------  -----------" 
00246             << std::endl;
00247 
00248   for (it_info=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.begin(); 
00249        it_info!=s_data->fBankToDetectorMap.end(); ++it_info){
00250     const std::string& bankname = it_info->first;
00251     std::cout << bankname << "  " 
00252               << s_data->GetDetectorName(bankname) << "\t\t" 
00253               << s_data->GetClockTick(bankname) << "\t" 
00254               << s_data->GetPedestal(bankname) << "\t\t" 
00255               << s_data->GetTriggerPolarity(bankname) << "\t\t" 
00256               << s_data->GetTimeShift(bankname) << "\t\t" 
00257               << s_data->GetNBits(bankname)
00258               << std::endl;
00259   }
00260 }

00262 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00263 Int_t PrepareAnalysedPulseMap(TFile* fileOut)
00264 {
00265   // TAnalysedMapWrapper
00266   gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper = new TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper(gAnalysedPulseMap);
00267   
00268   int split = 1;
00269   int bufsize = 64000;
00270   Int_t branchstyle = 1;
00271   
00272   if (split < 0) {branchstyle = 0; split = -1-split;}
00273   TTree::SetBranchStyle(branchstyle);
00274   
00275   gAnalysedPulseTree = new TTree("AnalysedPulseTree", "AnalysedPulseTree");
00276   gAnalysedPulseTree->SetAutoSave(100000000);
00277   gAnalysedPulseTree->SetMaxVirtualSize(100000000);
00278   gAnalysedPulseBranch = gAnalysedPulseTree->Branch("AnalysedPulseMapWrapper", 
00279                                                     "TAnalysedPulseMapWrapper",
00280                                                     &gAnalysedPulseMapWrapper,
00281                                                     bufsize, split);
00282   gAnalysedPulseBranch->SetAutoDelete(kFALSE);
00283   return 0;
00284 }

00286 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00287 Int_t PrepareSingletonObjects(const ARGUMENTS&){
00288   // Set up the modules navigator
00289   if(!modules::navigator::Instance()) return 1;
00290   
00291   // Make sure the instance of TSetupData get's loaded 
00292   // (though in practice we can do this lazily)
00293   if( !EventNavigator::Instance().GetSetupData() ) return 2;
00294   
00295   return 0;
00296 }
